section.title: Messages
section.label: All programs have a 'standard error stream' which they can write text messages to. ROX-Session creates such a connection between itself and every program it starts. It displays all the messages it collects this way briefly on screen.

frame.label: On-screen message log
You can click button-3 on an error message to switch to the log window display, or use this button:
frame.numentry: Number of seconds to display each message for

Normally, messages are shown overlayed on the screen for a few seconds. If there are a large number of messages (more than this amount of the screen is covered) then the view switches to the window style.

frame.label: Power

These commands can be selected in the Logout box as alternatives to logging out. The correct settings vary between different systems. You may need to use xsu or sudo with the command if your system doesn't give normal users permission to shutdown the system.
frame.entry: Likely commands for halting are 'halt' and 'shutdown -t now'
Likely rebooting commands are 'reboot' and 'shutdown -t now -r'

If your system uses APM for power management, try 'apm -s' or similar. ACPI users could try 'xset dpms force off; echo 1 > /proc/acpi/sleep'. You'll need a kernel with the correct system compiled in and enabled.
